documentation/postman.name: Aggregate GitHub User & Repos
documentation/postman.description: Demonstrates API composition by aggregating user profile and repositories from GitHub API in parallel

documentation/openapi.summary: Merges two calls from github and serves under a single endpoint
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint fetches in parallel the user information and the repository information from Githuib and returns it together. Non interesting fields are removed.

custom_fields.name: Aggregation and basic transformation

API Composition.@comment: EE only feature: Advanced transformation with query language

modifier/jmespath.@comment: Get first 5 crypto by market capitalization, then reverse sort them by name, finally filter and rename some fields
modifier/jmespath.expr: reverse(sort_by(collection[:5], &name))[*].{name: name, token: symbol,price: current_price, price_change: price_change_percentage_24h, market_cap: market_cap}

documentation/postman.name: Transform Crypto Data with JMESPath
documentation/postman.description: Advanced response transformation using JMESPath query language to filter and sort cryptocurrency market data

documentation/openapi.summary: Get TOP 5 crypto capitalization & price data for a given currency
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint fetches some crypto capitalization data from Coingecko for a given currency.

custom_fields.name: Advanced transformation with query language

regexp.@comment: Ridiculous card masking. Show last 4 digits and remove the rest. Credit card number is nested.

documentation/postman.name: Mask Credit Card Number
documentation/postman.description: Demonstrates data masking using regex to hide sensitive credit card information (shows only last 4 digits)

documentation/openapi.summary: Mask the credit card number
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint fetches the user information and masks the credit card number

custom_fields.name: Regular expression manipulation

API Composition.@comment: Feature: Two types of rate limiting on aggregated content

documentation/postman.name: Multi-Level Rate Limiting
documentation/postman.description: Demonstrates router-level and backend-level rate limiting on aggregated shop data (campaigns + products)

documentation/openapi.summary: Aggregates campaigns and products from the shop using different ratelimits
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint fetches the campaigns and products from the shop. The campaigns are fetched without ratelimit, but the products are fetched with a rate limit of 1 request per second. The endpoint itself has a rate limit of 2 requests per second.

custom_fields.name: Two types of rate limiting on aggregated content

API Composition.@comment: Feature: Sequential calls, using values from 1st call response into 2nd call request

documentation/postman.name: Sequential API Calls
documentation/postman.description: Demonstrates sequential requests where second call uses data from first response (hotel -> destination lookup)

documentation/openapi.summary: Chains two sequential API calls where the second depends on the first
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint demonstrates sequential processing by first fetching a hotel, then using its destination_id to fetch destination details. The second call cannot start until the first completes.

custom_fields.name: Sequential calls, using values from 1st call response into 2nd call request

documentation/postman.name: Mocked Static Response
documentation/postman.description: Returns static mocked data without calling the backend - useful for testing and development

documentation/openapi.summary: Mocked response
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint returns a mocked response when the backend is not available

custom_fields.name: Mocked response

Authentication & Security.@comment: Feature: Security policy engine for requests, responses and claim checking

error.body: User did not accept the cookie and tracking is not allowed

documentation/postman.name: GDPR Cookie Policy Enforcement
documentation/postman.description: Enforces security policy requiring GDPR cookie acceptance before allowing tracking requests

documentation/openapi.summary: Tracks user activity when the GDPR cookie is accepted
documentation/openapi.description: Example on how to abort a request based on a security policy. If the user does not have the GDPR cookie set to 'yes', the request will be aborted.

custom_fields.name: Security policy engine for requests, responses and claim checking

Authentication & Security.@comment: Feature: A public endpoint that requires no authentication

documentation/postman.description: Baseline public endpoint requiring no authentication - useful for testing

documentation/openapi.summary: Public endpoint
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint is public and requires no authentication

documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint offers a web interface to present auth/authz flow with Keycloack.

Authentication & Security.@comment: Feature: Authorization based on JWT (using Keycloak)

documentation/postman.description: Protected endpoint using KrakenD's internal JWT signing with role-based authorization

documentation/openapi.summary: Sign a token cryptographically (KrakenD JOSE signer)
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint uses the KrakenD JOSE signer to sign plain tokens coming from the backend and helpiong you to adopt cryptography easily

Authentication & Security.@comment: Feature: JWT signing, as described at https://www.krakend.io/docs/authorization/jwt-signing/

documentation/postman.description: Signs backend tokens (access_token, refresh_token) using KrakenD JWT signer

Authentication & Security.@comment: EE only feature: Authorization based on API Keys

documentation/postman.description: Protected endpoint requiring valid API key with 'admin' role (Enterprise-only feature)

documentation/postman.name: Backend HTTP Cache
documentation/postman.description: Demonstrates backend response caching using Cache-Control headers to reduce external API calls

documentation/openapi.summary: Local cache for the crypto market information
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint caches the responses from the Coingecko API for the time returned in the Cache-Control header.

custom_fields.name: Backend cache

Performance & QoS.@comment: Feature: Concurrent calls - Initial example with no concurrent calls enabled (normal)

documentation/postman.name: Simple Request (No Concurrency)
documentation/postman.description: Baseline example of a single non-concurrent API call to external service

documentation/openapi.summary: Simple fetch of external data without concurrent calls enabled
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint fetches crypto market information from Coingecko using a single non-concurrent call.

custom_fields.name: Concurrent calls - Initial example with no concurrent calls enabled (normal)

Performance & QoS.@comment: Feature: Concurrent calls - Example with concurrent calls enabled (more speed, less errors)

documentation/postman.name: Concurrent Requests (3x)
documentation/postman.description: Demonstrates concurrent calls feature - makes 3 parallel requests and returns the fastest successful response

documentation/openapi.summary: Get crypto market information with 3 concurrent calls
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint fetches crypto market information from Coingecko using 3 concurrent calls. Returns the fastest successful response and discards the rest

custom_fields.name: Concurrent calls - Example with concurrent calls enabled (more speed, less errors)

Routing & Wildcards.@comment: EE only feature: Wildcard to our fake API, open

documentation/postman.description: Public wildcard endpoint forwarding all paths under /fake-api/* to backend service

documentation/openapi.summary: Calls to internal service with wildcard
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint will send all requests to a designed backend including everything after the /fake-api path

Routing & Wildcards.@comment: EE only feature: Wildcard to our fake API, protected with Basic Auth

extra_config.@comment: The simple inclusion of the Auth Basic component enables it for this endpoint

Routing & Wildcards.@comment: EE only feature: Dynamic routing based on headers (token claim and cookie also available)

documentation/postman.name: Dynamic Routing by Header
documentation/postman.description: Routes to different backend paths based on X-Route header value (test with: curl -H 'X-Route: hello')

documentation/openapi.summary: Route to the backend using the content of the 'X-Route' header
documentation/openapi.description: This endpoint demonstrates dynamic routing by using the X-Route header value to determine the backend path. Test with: curl -iG -H 'X-Route: hello' 'http://localhost:8080/dynamic/header'

backend.@comment: We will route to the backend using the content of the 'X-Route' header
